definition[0]: to make a long deep sound because you are in pain, upset, or disappointed, or because something is very enjoyable
example[0]: The kids all groaned when I switched off the TV.
example[1]: Richard’s jokes make you groan rather than laugh.
example[2]: As she kissed him, Gary groaned with pleasure.
example[3]: I’m tired of him moaning and groaning all the time.
definition[2]: to make a low deep sound
example[5]: The old tree groaned in the wind.
definition[3]: if a table groans with food, there is a very large amount of food on it
definition[4]: a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do something
example[6]: Casey let out a groan of protest.
example[7]: The door opened with a groan.
